bestBHT.bht: As he witnessed the catch of fish, amazement encompassed him. It was a haul so astonishing that wonder held Peter and all those with him. This catch was of such magnitude that it surpassed anything they had ever experienced before. This miracle demonstrated the influence of Christ on the fish and revealed his dominion over creation. From this moment on, Peter's life would be forever transformed as he embarked on the mission of catching men.

Marvin Vincent: He was astonished. Lit., amazement encompassed him."
The draught. The word is used both of the act of catching and of that which is caught.
In verse 4 it has the former sense: 'let down your net for catching:' here, the latter, the catch or haul.
Philip Schaff: This miracle seems more than one of knowledge. It is true the shoals of fish in the lake are very thick, but the promise of Luke 5:10 (‘Henceforth thou shalt catch men’) points to an influence of Christ’s upon the fish." (Luke 5:9)

Christ here appears as the ideal man, the second Adam of the eighth Psalm: 'Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands: Thou hast put all things under His feet the fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoever walketh through the paths of the seas' (Luke 5:6; Luke 5:8)." (Luke 5:9)
From henceforth thou shalt catch men." (Luke 5:10)
Archibald T. Robertson: For he was amazed (θαμβος γαρ περιεσχεν). Literally,
For a wonder held him round . Aorist active indicative. It held Peter fast and all the rest.
John Gill: Far he was astonished, and all that were with him."
At the draught of the fishes they had taken.
Being so large and numerous, as the like was never seen, nor known by them before.

bhtAttempts.bht: Amazement surrounded him as he witnessed the catch of fish before him. This catch was not just an ordinary one, but rather a miraculous one that amazed not only Peter, but all those with him. It was a haul so large and unprecedented that it astounded them all. This miracle went beyond mere knowledge, as it hinted at the influence of Christ on the fish. It revealed Christ's dominion and authority over His creation, as He fulfilled the role of the ideal man mentioned in the eighth Psalm. From that point on, Peter's life would change forever, as he would go on to be a fisher of men.

Amazement encompassed him as he witnessed the miraculous catch of fish. This wasn't just any catch, but a haul so astonishing that it held Peter and everyone with him in wonder. It was a catch of such magnitude and abundance that it surpassed anything they had ever experienced before. This miracle went beyond mere knowledge, pointing to the influence of Christ on the fish and demonstrating His dominion over creation. From that moment, Peter's life would be forever changed as he embarked on a new mission to catch men.
